input: Question: Tell me a bio of Doug Sheehan.
output: Doug Sheehan is an American actor best known for his role as Ben Galvin in the hit television drama series, Knots Landing. He has also appeared in films such as The Big Easy and The Last Boy Scout, and television shows such as NYPD Blue and Beverly Hills, 90210. He was born in Los Angeles, California on August 24, 1956. Sheehan attended the University of California, Los Angeles, where he received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Theatre Arts. He has been married since 1984 to Lisa Cooper and has two children.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Lanny Flaherty.
output: Lanny Flaherty (born October 2, 1973) is an American actor, director and producer. He is best known for his roles in the television series The Closer, Rizzoli & Isles and the film American Pie. He has also appeared in numerous other movies and television shows including Without a Trace, The West Wing, CSI: NY and Grey's Anatomy. Flaherty began his acting career in 1995 with a role in the television movie The Christmas Tree. Since then he has gone on to appear in a number of feature films including American Pie, The Dukes of Hazzard, Supercross and The Devil's Rejects. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Chaim Malinowitz.
output: Chaim Malinowitz is a rabbi, author, and speaker. He is the founder of the Jewish Learning Group and has served as a rabbi in New York City, Miami Beach, and Philadelphia. He has written two books, A Rabbi Looks at the Last Days: What the Bible Really Says About the End Times and A Rabbi Looks at the Messiah and the End of Days. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Focus....
output: Focus is an English rock band formed in 1969 by keyboardist/vocalist and songwriter Thijs van Leer, drummer Hans Cleuver, guitarist Jan Akkerman, and bassist Bobby Jacobs. Their music is characterised by van Leer's accomplished use of the classical flute, acoustic guitar, and organ, combined with Akkerman's jazz-inspired, blues rock influenced guitar style. The band has had a number of line-up changes over the years, with van Leer being the only constant member. Their greatest commercial success was the 1971 single "Hocus Pocus" which reached the top 10 in the UK Singles Chart. They are also well known for the singles "Sylvia" and "House of the King". Focus split up in 1978 but reunited in 2002 and have since been touring and releasing albums.

He is most well-known for inventing the Fischer Computer, a computer system used in the late 1970s to support the development of educational software. Fischer is also known for his work in the field of artificial intelligence and intelligent user interfaces. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Quintus Sosius Senecio.
output: Quintus Sosius Senecio was a Roman politician who served as a consul in the year 97 AD. He was the son of Quintus Sosius Senecio and the brother of Lucius Sosius Senecio. He began his political career as a praetor urbanus before becoming a consul. He is best known for his involvement in the Roman-Parthian War of 97-99 AD. During this war, he was appointed as the governor of Cappadocia and was responsible for the Roman victory in Armenia. He later became a proconsul in Africa and was a close ally of Emperor Trajan. He died in the year 120 AD.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Jean Daullé.
output: Jean Daullé (1835–1897) was a French painter, engraver, and lithographer. He studied at the École des Beaux-Arts in Paris, and his works were mainly executed in oil, pastel and watercolour. He was a member of the Salon des Artistes Français from 1867 to 1893 and was awarded a Bronze Medal at the Exposition Universelle of 1889. His works were mainly of landscapes, genre scenes and portraits, often featuring scenes of rural life. His paintings are held in the collections of the Musée d'Orsay in Paris, the Musée des Beaux-Arts in Lyon and the Musée des Augustins in Toulouse.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Vincenzo Tusa.
output: Vincenzo Tusa is an Italian paleontologist and archaeologist. He is the Director of the Department of Underwater Cultural Heritage of the Ministry of Cultural Heritage and Activities in Rome. He is best known for his work in the investigation of ancient shipwrecks in the Mediterranean Sea. He was born in Palermo, Sicily, in 1952 and graduated from the University of Palermo with a degree in Natural Sciences. He has held numerous positions in the Italian cultural heritage sector, including Deputy Director of the Department of Underwater Archaeology at the Ministry of Cultural Heritage and Activities and Regional Director of Archaeology at the Ministry of Education, University and Research. He is a member of the International Congress of Underwater Archaeologists, the Institute of Nautical Archaeology, and the Archaeological Institute of America. He has published numerous articles on maritime and underwater archaeology, and has contributed to a number of books on the subject. He has also received numerous awards for his work, including the Gold Medal from the Italian Ministry of Culture and the Primo Premio della Fondazione UNESCO.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of María Elena Medina-Mora Icaza.
output: María Elena Medina-Mora Icaza is a Mexican lawyer and diplomat. She was born in Mexico City in 1951 and graduated from the National Autonomous University of Mexico in 1974 with a degree in law. She then studied at the University of Paris II, Panthéon-Assas, where she earned a master's degree in 1979. She has served in various diplomatic posts, including Ambassador to the United Kingdom (1998–2002), Ambassador to the Netherlands (2005–2009), Ambassador to France (2010–2013), and Ambassador to Switzerland (2013–2015). She is currently the Permanent Representative of Mexico to the United Nations in New York. She has also held various positions within the Mexican government, such as Director of International Organizations and Conferences in the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and Director of the Department of International Security and Disarmament in the same ministry. She is a member of the Mexican Academy of International Law.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Zelma Wilson.
output: Zelma Wilson was born on October 19, 1940 in Atlanta, Georgia. She attended Spelman College and graduated with a degree in sociology and a minor in psychology. After college, Zelma worked for the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare, eventually moving to the Department of Labor in Washington, DC. She was the first African-American woman to be promoted to a management position in the Department of Labor, and was a leader in the Civil Rights Movement. In addition to her civil rights work, Zelma was a passionate advocate for women's rights and worked to promote equal employment opportunities for women in the workplace. She was also an active member of the National Council of Negro Women and the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP). Zelma passed away in 2014 at the age of 73.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Bella Akhmadulina.
output: Bella Akhmadulina (1937-2010) was a Russian poet, novelist and journalist. She was born in Moscow in 1937 to a Tatar father and Russian mother, and grew up in Moscow. Akhmadulina's first poems were published in the mid-1950s, and she quickly became one of the most celebrated poets of the Soviet era. She was one of the most prominent members of the “village prose” literary movement, which focused on the lives of ordinary people in rural Russia. Akhmadulina was awarded numerous literary awards, including the Lenin Prize in 1987 and the State Prize of the Russian Federation in 2000. She also served as president of the Union of Russian Writers from 1992 to 1998. Akhmadulina died in 2010 at the age of 72.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Rennie Fritchie, Baroness Fritchie.
output: Rennie Fritchie, Baroness Fritchie, is a British Labour politician and life peer. She was created a life peer as Baroness Fritchie, of Oldham in Greater Manchester in the County of Greater Manchester in 2007. She has served in the House of Lords since then. Prior to joining the House of Lords, she worked in local government in Oldham, and served as a councillor from 1984-2005. She has also held a number of positions in the Labour Party, including as chair of the North West Regional Women's Committee from 2000-2004, and was an active member of the Co-operative Party. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Francesco Mimbelli.
output: Francesco Mimbelli is an Italian architect, urban planner, and professor of Architecture and Urban Planning at the University of Florence. He is known for his works in the field of urban planning and the development of public spaces in Italian cities. He has designed numerous public spaces, such as the Albergo degli Ulivi in Florence, the Parco delle Cascine in Florence, the Parco delle Cinque Torri in Rome, and the Parco degli Ulivi in Naples. He is also an advocate of sustainable urban development and has participated in various projects related to this topic. He has written and edited numerous publications, such as “Urban Planning in Italy”, “Urban Planning and Sustainable Development”, and “Urban Planning for Sustainable Urbanism”. He is a member of the board of directors of the Italian Association for Urban Planning and a member of the Italian National Commission for Urban Planning.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Frederick Howard Taylor.
output: Frederick Winslow Taylor (March 20, 1856 – March 21, 1915) was an American mechanical engineer and the father of scientific management. He is considered to be the first management consultant. Taylor was one of the first modern efficiency engineers and was a pioneer in developing the field of industrial engineering. He was also a public speaker and writer, best known for his book The Principles of Scientific Management, which was published in 1911. He was born in Germantown, Philadelphia and educated at Phillips Exeter Academy and Stevens Institute of Technology. He began his career as a machinist and shop foreman in a steel plant. He eventually rose to the position of Chief Engineer of the Manufacturing Investment Company, a consulting firm he founded. Taylor believed that efficiency could be improved by breaking down production processes into their basic elements and optimizing the performance of each task. He developed a system of management that focused on the optimization of the production process and the organization of the workplace. This system, which became known as scientific management, was widely adopted in the early 20th century and is still used in many industries today.

output: Idriss Ngari is a multi-instrumentalist, composer, and arranger from Chad. He has been performing and composing music since he was a child, and has been performing around the world for over a decade. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Gonzalo Fonseca.
output: Gonzalo Fonseca (1922-1997) was a Uruguayan-born sculptor and architect who was known for his abstract, minimalist sculptures and buildings. He studied architecture in Montevideo, Uruguay and then moved to Brazil in the early 1950s. He worked in São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro and Brasília, where he became a professor at the University of Brasília. He also exhibited his work in numerous international exhibitions, including the Venice Biennale in 1964. Fonseca's work is characterized by its use of simple geometric forms, such as cubes, cylinders and pyramids, which he combined to create dynamic compositions. He was also influenced by the minimalist sculptors of the 1960s, including Carl Andre and Dan Flavin.

output: Antonio Diaz is a Filipino politician and former Governor of the province of Occidental Mindoro. He was born on June 28, 1952 in Oriental Mindoro. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Shayne Neumann.
output: Shayne Neumann is an Australian politician who has been the Member of Parliament for Blair in Queensland since 2007. He is a member of the Australian Labor Party and served as Shadow Minister for Veterans' Affairs from 2013 to 2019. Neumann was born in Brisbane and attended Brisbane State High School and the University of Queensland, where he completed a Bachelor of Arts degree. He then went on to practice as a lawyer in Queensland for over 25 years. Neumann was first elected to the House of Representatives in 2007, and was re-elected four times. In 2013, he was appointed Shadow Minister for Immigration and Border Protection and then, in 2016, Shadow Minister for Veterans' Affairs. He has also served as a member of the Joint Standing Committee on Foreign Affairs, Defence and Trade.

output: Jagan Mohan Reddy is an Indian politician and the current Chief Minister of Andhra Pradesh. Jagan studied his B.Com from Narayana Junior College in Hyderabad. He has a MBA from Princeton University, U.S.A. He was elected to the Lok Sabha from the Kadapa constituency in 2014. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Nisar Ahmad Kakru.
output: Nisar Ahmad Kakru is a noted Indian homeopathic physician and professor who has served as the Principal of the Government Homeopathic Medical College in Srinagar. He is a widely recognized authority on homeopathic medicine and has authored several books, including the book “Textbook of Homeopathy for Practitioners”. Kakru graduated from the Government Homeopathic Medical College in Srinagar in the year 1971 and completed his post-graduation in the year 1974 from the same college. He also obtained a Masters in Homeopathic Medicine from Bombay University in the year 1981. Kakru has held several prestigious positions such as the Director of the Central Council of Homeopathy in Delhi and the Vice-President of the Indian Homeopathic Medical Association. He has also served as the President of the Indian Association of Homeopathic Physicians. Kakru has been honored with numerous awards for his contributions to the field of homeopathy, including the Padma Shri Award in the year 2006.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Virginia Valli.
output: Virginia Valli (born Virginia McSweeney; May 5, 1895 – September 12, 1968) was an American actress who worked primarily in silent films. She was born in Chicago, Illinois, the daughter of Irish immigrants. She began her career as a stage actress in the early 1910s, and made her first film appearance in 1914. During the silent era, Valli appeared in more than 120 films, most notably The Phantom of the Opera (1925) and The Cat and the Canary (1927). She was often cast as the ingénue in melodramas, and had a successful career until the advent of sound films. Valli retired from the film industry in 1934 and returned to the stage, appearing in several Broadway productions. She died in 1968 in California.

Featherstone was born in Leominster, Massachusetts, and studied at the Massachusetts College of Art. His career began in 1956 when he was hired by Union Products, a small plastics company in Leominster, to create a three-dimensional lawn ornament. After much trial and error, Featherstone created the now iconic pink plastic flamingo lawn ornament. The flamingo became an instant hit, and Featherstone continued to work for Union Products for the rest of his career. In 2007, Featherstone was inducted into the National Inventors Hall of Fame for his invention of the flamingo. He was also posthumously inducted into the Plastics Hall of Fame in 2017.

He is best known for holding the record for the longest confirmed kill shot in military history, at 2,430 metres (2,657 yards). He served in the Canadian Army from 1992 to 2006 and was deployed to Afghanistan with the Princess Patricia's Canadian Light Infantry (PPCLI) in 2002. output: Alexandre Guilmant (1837-1911) was a French organist, composer, and teacher. He was an important figure in the development of organ music and a major influence on the French organ school. He was born in Boulogne-sur-Mer and studied music at the Paris Conservatoire with François Benoist, François-Joseph Fétis, and François Habeneck. Guilmant was organist at Saint-Nicolas-des-Champs in Paris from 1857-1864 and at the Church of the Madeleine from 1864-1911. He was one of the first organists to use the organ to accompany choirs and orchestras and also wrote many organ works. He also wrote numerous chamber works, including a trio for piano, violin, and cello. Guilmant was a professor of organ at the Paris Conservatoire from 1871-1909, and wrote several books on the subject of organ music. He died in 1911 in Paris.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of William Waldegrave, Baron Waldegrave of North Hill.
output: William Waldegrave, Baron Waldegrave of North Hill, is a British Conservative politician. He served in Margaret Thatcher's cabinet in the late 1980s and early 1990s and later became a life peer in 1999. He was educated at Eton College and Balliol College, Oxford, and served in the British Army in Germany and the Middle East. He was a Member of Parliament (MP) from 1983 to 1997, representing the constituency of Bristol West. He served in several government positions, most notably as Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster (1989–90), Secretary of State for Health (1990–92), and Paymaster General (1992–94). He was also a senior advisor to Prime Minister John Major. After leaving Parliament, he was a senior advisor to the London Stock Exchange and Chairman of the British Museum. He has written several books on political and historical topics, and is a patron of several charities.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Martín Lousteau.
output: Martín Lousteau is an Argentine economist, entrepreneur, and politician. He served as Economy Minister of Argentina from December 2007 to July 2008. Lousteau studied Economics at the University of Buenos Aires, where he graduated in 1998 as a Fulbright Scholar. In 2000 he obtained a Master's degree in International Economic Policy from Columbia University. In 2001 he joined the consulting firm McKinsey & Company, serving as an analyst in New York and later in Buenos Aires. From 2003 to 2007, he worked as an independent consultant for national and international companies and organizations. He was appointed Economy Minister by President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner in December 2007, becoming the youngest minister in Argentine history. As Minister of Economy, Lousteau pushed for a number of reforms and initiatives, such as the implementation of a new tax system, a new exchange rate system, and the creation of an international financial center in Buenos Aires. He resigned from his post in July 2008. Since then, he has served as a professor at several universities, including the University of Buenos Aires and the University of San Andrés. He is also the founder and CEO of the NGO Fundación Progresar.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Scientist (musician).
output: Scientist (born Leighton H. Ford, c. 1961) is a Jamaican dub musician and producer. He is well known for his innovative production techniques and his production work with artists such as King Tubby, Lee "Scratch" Perry, and Augustus Pablo. Scientist has released several albums, including Scientist Rids the World of the Evil Curse of the Vampires (1981), Scientist Wins the World Cup (1982), and The Best Dub Album in the World (1985). He has been a major influence on the development of the dub genre, and his work is considered to be some of the most influential in the history of reggae music.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Waruhiu Itote.
output: Waruhiu Itote, also known as General China, was a Kenyan freedom fighter who played a major role in the Mau Mau Uprising against British rule in the 1950s. Born in 1919 in the settlement of Gathigiriri in Central Province, Kenya, he was a member of the Kikuyu tribe. After attending mission schools, Itote joined the British Army in World War II, serving in East Africa and Europe. Following the war, he returned to Kenya and became a leader of the Mau Mau rebellion. He distinguished himself in military engagements, leading the group to several victories, and became one of the most respected leaders of the movement. After Kenya's independence was achieved in 1963, Itote retired from military service and went on to become a politician, serving as an MP in the first Kenyan Parliament. He passed away in 2007 at the age of 88.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Ramesses IV.
output: Ramesses IV (also known as Ramses) was the third Pharaoh of the Twentieth Dynasty of Egypt. He ruled from 1163-1156 BC. He was the son of Ramesses III and Queen Tiy. He was known as a great builder, constructing temples and monuments throughout Egypt, as well as restoring existing monuments. He also conducted several successful military campaigns and was noted for his extensive diplomatic activity. He is best known for his tomb in the Valley of the Kings. He died in 1156 BC and was succeeded by his son Ramesses V.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Takeo Miki.
output: Takeo Miki (1907-1988) was a Japanese politician who served as the Prime Minister of Japan from 1974 to 1976. He was a member of the Liberal Democratic Party and held many important positions in the party. He was a major proponent of the "peace constitution" and the Treaty of Mutual Cooperation and Security between Japan and the United States. Miki was born in Shiga Prefecture, Japan, and educated at Tokyo Imperial University, where he received a law degree. After World War II, he became a prominent figure in the Liberal Democratic Party. He was elected to the House of Representatives in 1947, and served in various cabinet positions, including Minister of Finance, Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Minister of International Trade and Industry. He was appointed Prime Minister in 1974 and served for two years until resigning due to poor health. In 1983, he was awarded the Order of the Chrysanthemum, one of Japan's highest honors. After his death in 1988, he was posthumously awarded the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Shashank Manohar.
output: Shashank Manohar is an Indian lawyer, cricket administrator, and former President of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). He is currently the Chairman of the International Cricket Council (ICC). He was born on 29 August 1956 in Nagpur, Maharashtra. He completed his Law degree from the Government Law College in Mumbai and his Masters in Law from the University of Cambridge. He started his career as a lawyer and later became a member of the BCCI in 2005. He was elected as the President of the BCCI in October 2015, and was re-elected for a second term in May 2016. He resigned from his post in May 2017. He was appointed as the non-executive Chairman of the ICC in May 2017. He is known for his strong stance on the issue of corruption in cricket and his commitment to good governance. He is also known for his role in the implementation of the Lodha reforms in the BCCI.

output: Ylona Jade Garcia (born September 16, 2004) is a Filipino-Australian singer, actress and television personality. She first rose to fame after joining the first season of the reality talent show, Pinoy Big Brother: 737 in 2015. She was declared the Big Winner of the season. Following her stint in the show, she released her debut single, "Dahlia," which peaked at number 2 on the Philippine charts. She has since released several singles, including "Ulitin Mo," "At Ako," and "Kilometro." She also starred in the 2019 film, "Miracle in Cell No. 7," and appeared in numerous television shows, such as Wansapanataym, Maalaala Mo Kaya and Goin' Bulilit. She is currently a co-host of the musical variety show, It's Showtime.

output: Kerser (born 1988 in Sydney, Australia) is a rapper, songwriter and producer. He has released four studio albums, two mixtapes and multiple EPs. His fourth studio album, S.C.O.T, was released in 2017 and reached number 4 on the ARIA Charts. He has also released a number of mix tapes, including A Matter Of Perspective (2012), The Nebulizer 2 (2013) and The Rider (2015). He is known for his aggressive lyrical flow and witty punchlines. output: Mitzi Gaynor (born September 4, 1931) is an American actress, singer, and dancer. She is best known for her performances in several classic movie musicals from the mid-1950s to the early 1970s, including South Pacific (1958), There's No Business Like Show Business (1954), and Les Girls (1957). She also starred in the Broadway musicals Wonderful Town (1953) and Follies (1971). Gaynor began her career as a chorus girl on Broadway before transitioning to film and television. She has appeared in numerous television series such as The Mitzi Gaynor Show, The Merv Griffin Show, and The Hollywood Palace. She also released several albums, including Mitzi (1959) and Mitzi Gaynor Sings the Lyrics of Ira Gershwin (1960). Gaynor has been honored with numerous awards and accolades, including a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and a lifetime achievement award from the American Society of Cinematographers.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of James B. Donovan.
output: James B. Donovan (1916-1970) was an American lawyer and negotiator who served as the General Counsel of the United States Department of Justice from 1957 to 1961. He is best known for his successful negotiation of the exchange of American U-2 spy plane pilot Francis Gary Powers for Soviet spy Rudolf Abel. He is also remembered for his involvement in the Nuremberg Trials, the creation of the International Refugee Organization, and his successful defense of accused Nazi war criminal Adolf Eichmann. He was an advocate for human rights and civil liberties throughout his career.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Andrew Shue.
output: Andrew Shue is an American actor, entrepreneur, and activist best known for his role as Billy Campbell on the television series Melrose Place (1992–1998). He also starred in the films The Wedding Singer (1998) and Gracie (2007). Shue co-founded CafeMom, an online social networking site for mothers, and DoSomething.org, a nonprofit organization that encourages young people to volunteer. He currently stars in the ABC drama series, The Forgotten. Shue was born in South Orange, New Jersey in 1964 and grew up in nearby Maplewood. He attended Columbia High School, where he played soccer and was a member of the school's state championship team. He attended Dartmouth College, and graduated with a degree in History in 1988.

Waka Flocka Flame gained mainstream success with his debut album Flockaveli, which was released in 2010. He has also released several mixtapes, including Salute Me or Shoot Me and DuFlocka Rant 2.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Anna May Wong.
output: Anna May Wong (1905–1961) was a pioneering Chinese-American actress and an early star of film and television. Born in Los Angeles, California, she was the first Chinese-American movie star and the first Asian-American actress to gain international recognition. She had a successful film career in Hollywood and Europe, making over 40 films and appearing in numerous television shows throughout her career. She is best known for her roles in Piccadilly (1929), The Toll of the Sea (1922), Shanghai Express (1932), and Daughter of the Dragon (1931). Wong was an outspoken advocate for Asian-American representation in Hollywood, and was a powerful figure in the fight against racism and sexism in the entertainment industry. Her legacy as a pioneering actress and advocate continues to this day.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Egon Krenz.
output: Egon Rudi Ernst Krenz (born 15 March 1937) is a former East German politician who served as the last leader of the German Democratic Republic (GDR), succeeding Erich Honecker on 18 October 1989. Following the fall of the Berlin Wall, he was arrested and sentenced to six-and-a-half years in prison for manslaughter and negligence in office. He was released on parole in late 1997. He was born in Kolberg in Pomerania, now part of Poland. He joined the Free German Youth (FDJ) in 1953 and the Socialist Unity Party of Germany (SED) in 1955. He studied engineering at the Karl Marx Higher Institute of Technology from 1956 to 1958 and served in the National People's Army from 1958 to 1960. He then worked as an engineer, eventually advancing to become a plant manager. From 1971 to 1976, he was a secretary in the SED Central Committee and a member of the People's Chamber from 1971 to 1990. After Honecker's fall from power in October 1989, Krenz was elected to succeed him as the leader of the SED and the GDR. After just over a month in office, the GDR ceased to exist and Krenz resigned his post.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Robert Louis Stevenson.
output: Robert Louis Stevenson (13 November 1850 – 3 December 1894) was a Scottish novelist, poet, essayist, and travel writer. His most famous works are Treasure Island, Kidnapped, and Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde. He was a literary celebrity during his lifetime, and now ranks among the 26 most translated authors in the world. He was an advocate of civil rights, and a supporter of feminist and socialist causes. He was a prolific writer and wrote more than 23 books, hundreds of short stories, and countless poems. He is remembered for his adventure novels, such as Treasure Island, and for his moving essays on the human condition, such as A Child's Garden of Verses. He died at the age of 44 from a cerebral haemorrhage.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of António de Oliveira Salazar.
output: António de Oliveira Salazar was a Portuguese statesman who served as Prime Minister of Portugal from 1932 to 1968. He was born in 1889 in the small town of Vimieiro, in the municipality of Santa Comba in northern Portugal. He was a devout Roman Catholic and a highly educated man, having studied law at the University of Coimbra and economics at the University of Paris. His economic policies, often referred to as "Salazarism," sought to protect Portuguese sovereignty and maintain a low debt-to-GDP ratio. Under Salazar, Portugal was largely isolationist, refusing to join the League of Nations or the United Nations. Salazar's regime was marked by authoritarianism, with censorship, the suppression of civil liberties, and the use of secret police and torture. He was overthrown in a 1974 military coup. He died in 1970 at the age of 81.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Heinrich Harrer.
output: Heinrich Harrer was an Austrian mountaineer, explorer, geographer, and author. He was born in 1912 in Austria and grew up in the Alps, where he developed a passion for mountaineering. In 1939, he and three other climbers attempted to make the first ascent of Nanga Parbat in the Himalayas, but were forced to turn back due to bad weather. After the outbreak of World War II, Harrer was arrested by the British and interned in a prisoner of war camp in India, where he remained until the end of the war. Following his release, he wrote several books about his experiences, including Seven Years in Tibet, which was later adapted into a movie. After the war, Harrer became a professor of geography and later served as an advisor to the Austrian government on mountain-climbing. He died in 2006 at the age of 93.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Annika Sörenstam.
output: Annika Sörenstam is a Swedish professional golfer who is regarded as one of the greatest female golfers of all time. She began playing golf at age 8 and went on to dominate the sport through the 1990s and 2000s, winning a total of 89 international tournaments—including 72 official Ladies Professional Golf Association (LPGA) tournaments. She was the first woman to shoot a 59 in competition, the first woman to make more than $20 million in career earnings, and the first woman to compete in a PGA Tour event. She retired in 2008 and is currently involved in a number of initiatives to promote the game of golf.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Vaira Vīķe-Freiberga.
output: Vaira Vīķe-Freiberga (born 1 December 1937) is a Latvian psychologist, politician, and the sixth President of Latvia (1999-2007). She is the first woman to serve as Latvian president and the first female President of the Baltic states. Vaira was born into a middle-class family in Riga. She studied psychology at the University of Latvia and the University of Montreal, where she earned her PhD in Experimental Psychology in 1965. She taught at the University of Montreal and the University of Latvia before becoming a professor at the University of Latvia in 1967. She was elected as the President of Latvia in 1999, and served until 2007. During her tenure, she focused on strengthening Latvia's international standing and promoting the country's economic development. She has also been involved in many international organisations, such as the United Nations and the Council of Europe. She is currently an honorary professor at the University of Latvia and a member of the European Council on Foreign Relations.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Beenie Man.
output: Beenie Man (born Anthony Moses Davis on August 22, 1973) is a Jamaican reggae and dancehall artist. He is widely considered one of the most significant and well-known artists in Jamaican music. His career began in the 1980s when he won the Tastee Talent contest, a local music competition. He has released over 22 studio albums and has won numerous awards, including a Grammy Award for Best Reggae Album in 2003. He is known for his signature style of “slackness”, which combines elements of dancehall and hip-hop. He has collaborated with a number of popular musicians, including Sean Paul, Wyclef Jean, and Stevie Wonder. He is also a prominent advocate for the rights of Jamaican artists, and has been a vocal supporter of the Jamaica Labour Party.

He is widely regarded as one of the greatest dribblers of all time, and was a member of the Brazilian national team that won the 1958 and 1962 World Cup. He is also remembered for his tragic personal life, which saw him struggle with alcoholism and poverty until his death in 1983. He was born in 1933 in Rio de Janeiro and made his professional debut in 1953 with Botafogo. He was known for his speed and dribbling ability, which helped him to be an integral part of the Brazilian team for over a decade. His career was cut short in 1966 due to a knee injury, and he passed away in 1983 due to cirrhosis of the liver.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Roberto Clemente.
output: Roberto Clemente was a Puerto Rican professional baseball player who played in Major League Baseball (MLB) as a right fielder for the Pittsburgh Pirates from 1955 to 1972. He was inducted into the National Baseball Hall of Fame in 1973, becoming the first Latin American and Caribbean player to be enshrined. His untimely death due to a plane crash on New Year's Eve 1972 while en route to deliver aid to earthquake victims in Nicaragua cemented his legacy in baseball history. Clemente was a 15-time All-Star and was the National League (NL) Most Valuable Player (MVP) in 1966. He won 12 Gold Glove Awards for his outstanding defensive play in right field and led the NL in batting average four times. He had a career batting average of .317 and finished with 3,000 career hits. He also hit 240 home runs and drove in 1,305 runs.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Gilberto Silva.
output: Gilberto Aparecido da Silva (born 7 October 1976) is a Brazilian former professional footballer who played as a defensive midfielder. He is currently the Technical Director of Brazilian club Atlético Mineiro. Gilberto began his career with América Mineiro in 1995, before moving to Atlético Mineiro the following season. In 1998, he was signed by German club Kaiserslautern and became the first Brazilian to play in the Bundesliga. He won the 1999–2000 Bundesliga title with the club, before joining Arsenal in 2002. He won the 2003–04 FA Cup and 2005–06 FA Cup with the Gunners, and was part of the team that went an entire league season unbeaten in 2003–04. He left Arsenal in 2008 and joined Greek side Panathinaikos, before returning to Atlético Mineiro in 2011. He was part of the Brazil squad that won the 2002 FIFA World Cup, and also represented his country at the 2006 World Cup.

output: Abdou Diallo is a professional footballer who currently plays for Bundesliga club Borussia Dortmund and the Senegal national team. input: Question: Tell me a bio of Paul Kruger.
output: Paul Kruger (1825–1904) was the president of the Transvaal Republic and a South African Boer leader who fought against the British in the Second Boer War. Born in the Cape Province of South Africa, Kruger was educated at mission schools and worked as a transport rider and shopkeeper before becoming a leader of the Boers. He was a member of the South African Republic's Volksraad (parliament) from 1858 to 1900 and its president from 1883 to 1900. He was responsible for the Transvaal's defense during the Second Boer War, but was eventually forced to surrender to the British in 1900. After the war, he went into exile in Europe, where he died in 1904.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Gabriela Sabatini.
output: Gabriela Beatriz Sabatini (born 16 May 1970) is an Argentine former professional tennis player. She was one of the leading players on the women's circuit in the late-1980s and early-1990s. She won the women's singles title at the US Open in 1990, the women's doubles title at Wimbledon in 1988, two Year-End Championships in 1988 and 1994, and a silver medal at the 1988 Olympic Games. She also won most of the highest tier regular events on the women's tour, including Miami and Rome. Sabatini retired from the professional tour in 1996.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of José Sánchez del Río.
output: José Sánchez del Río (1913-1928) was a Mexican boy who was martyred for his faith in the Cristeros War (1926-1929). He was born in the town of Sahuayo, Michoacán, and was the son of a shoemaker. He was a fervent Catholic and was deeply devoted to the Virgin of Guadalupe. He was captured by the Mexican government forces and tortured for refusing to renounce his faith. After suffering horrible torture, he was ultimately executed by firing squad at the age of 14. His martyrdom inspired the Cristero rebels to continue fighting for religious freedom. He was beatified by Pope John Paul II in 2005.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Kyu Sakamoto.
output: Kyu Sakamoto (坂本 九, Sakamoto Kyū, born Hisashi Oshima, January 10, 1941 – August 12, 1985) was a Japanese singer and actor, best known outside Japan for his international hit song "Sukiyaki", which was released under the artist name Kyu Sakamoto in Japan and as "Sukiyaki" in the US. He also had a successful career in Japan as a singer and actor. He was born in Kawasaki, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan, and started his career in 1959 as a singer of the group The Drifters. He released his first solo single, "Ue o Muite Arukō" (known in the United States as "Sukiyaki") in 1961. The song topped the Billboard Hot 100 chart in the US in 1963 and became a worldwide hit, selling over 13 million copies. He released more than 20 singles and 20 albums in his career, and acted in more than 30 movies and television dramas. He died in the crash of Japan Airlines Flight 123 in 1985.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Jimmy Bartel.
output: Jimmy Bartel is a former professional Australian rules footballer who played for the Geelong Football Club in the Australian Football League (AFL). He was drafted by Geelong in the 2001 AFL Draft and went on to win three AFL premierships with the club, in 2007, 2009 and 2011. He was awarded the Brownlow Medal in 2007 and the Norm Smith Medal in 2011. He was also named in the All-Australian team on three occasions in 2007, 2008 and 2011. After Geelong's 2011 Grand Final victory, Bartel retired from AFL football. He is now a media personality, appearing on Channel 7's The Front Bar, and is involved in various charities, including the Jimmy Bartel Foundation, which provides support to those suffering from depression and anxiety.

She was also the editor of Surya, an influential Indian magazine. She has been a major advocate of animal rights in India and has been involved in campaigns to end animal cruelty. She is also an advocate for the protection of India's wildlife and natural resources.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Ram Gopal Varma.
output: Ram Gopal Varma is an Indian film director, screenwriter, and producer, known for his work in Telugu and Hindi films. He has directed films across multiple genres, including horror, suspense, and comedy. He has also worked in television and music videos. Varma first gained recognition for his crime drama, Shiva (1989), which won critical acclaim and went on to become a cult classic. He has since directed several successful films, including Rangeela (1995), Satya (1998), Company (2002), Sarkar (2005), and The Attacks of 26/11 (2013). He has also produced and directed several documentaries, including the award-winning My Indian Soldier (2003). Varma has won several awards for his work, including two National Film Awards, five Filmfare Awards, two IIFA Awards, and two Star Screen Awards.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Wendy (singer).
output: Wendy (born Son Seung-wan on February 21, 1994) is a South Korean singer and dancer. She is a part of the South Korean girl group Red Velvet, which debuted in 2014 under SM Entertainment. Wendy made her solo debut in 2020 and released her first solo studio album, Like Water, in 2021. She has also released two solo singles, “Love Is You” and “When This Rain Stops”. Wendy is known for her powerful vocal range and soulful ballads. She is also a skilled dancer, having taken part in several dance projects. Wendy has also featured in numerous OSTs, including for the drama series “Love in the Moonlight” and “Descendants of the Sun”. In addition to her music career, Wendy also has a successful modelling career, having been featured in campaigns for brands such as Celine, Givenchy, and Fendi.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Cha Seung-won.
output: Cha Seung-won (born Cha No-hae on 7 June 1971) is a South Korean actor and singer. He is best known for his roles in television dramas such as City Hall (2009), The Greatest Love (2011), and You're All Surrounded (2014). He has also starred in films such as Jail Breakers (2002), Classic (2003), and Voice of a Murderer (2007). He is also the leader of a hip-hop duo called "V.O.S", and released his first solo album in 2008. He is currently signed to the talent agency A-Man Project.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Sajid Nadiadwala.
output: Sajid Nadiadwala is an Indian film producer and director. He is the founder of the production house Nadiadwala Grandson Entertainment Pvt. Ltd. He has produced over 50 films, including blockbusters such as Judwaa (1997), Housefull (2010), Kick (2014) and Baaghi (2016). He has also directed four films, including the comedy-drama Welcome Back (2015). Nadiadwala is a recipient of a National Film Award and two Filmfare Awards. input: Question: Tell me a bio of James Taylor.
output: James Taylor is an American singer-songwriter and guitarist. He was born in Boston, Massachusetts in 1948. He is best known for his soft-rock music, which often contains introspective and poignant lyrics, and his distinctive voice. Taylor achieved his breakthrough in 1970 with his single "Fire and Rain" and had his first number one hit in 1971 with "You've Got a Friend". He has recorded more than 20 studio albums and has sold more than 100 million records worldwide. Taylor is one of the best-selling artists of all time, and was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2000. He continues to tour and perform live, and his latest studio album, American Standard, was released in 2020.

She has had a successful career in both film and television, and has been nominated for many awards, including a Golden Globe. Moynahan studied acting at the American Academy of Dramatic Arts, and began her career in the late 1990s, appearing in a number of television shows. She has also appeared in a number of feature films, including Coyote Ugly, Serendipity and The Recruit. Moynahan is also an advocate for environmental causes, appearing in a number of documentaries on the subject. She is the mother of a son with Tom Brady, the quarterback for the New England Patriots.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Harrison Ford.
output: Harrison Ford (born July 13, 1942) is an American actor and film producer. He is best known for his performances as Han Solo in the original Star Wars trilogy and as the title character of the Indiana Jones film series. Five of his films have been inducted into the National Film Registry by the Library of Congress. Ford is also known for playing the role of the father in the film What Lies Beneath (2000). He is married to actress Calista Flockhart and has four children. Ford is one of the highest-grossing actors of all time and has won numerous awards. He is one of the few actors to have achieved the Triple Crown of Acting, having won an Academy Award, an Emmy Award, and a Tony Award. He was also inducted into the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2003.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Errol Flynn.
output: Errol Flynn (1909-1959) was an Australian-American actor known for his swashbuckling roles in adventure films during the 1930s and 1940s. He starred in such classic films as The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938), The Sea Hawk (1940), and Captain Blood (1935). Flynn was an international movie star, appearing in dozens of films throughout Europe and the United States. He also had a passion for sailing and gambling, which often got him into trouble with the law. His life was filled with both triumph and tragedy, including several brushes with the law, personal bankruptcies, and even death by heart attack in 1959 at the age of 50. Despite his storied life, Flynn will always be remembered as the quintessential Hollywood swashbuckler.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Eliza Dushku.

She currently resides in Los Angeles, California.

output: Liam James Payne (born 29 August 1993) is an English singer and songwriter. He rose to fame as a member of the boy band One Direction. After being eliminated as a solo performer, he auditioned again in 2010 and was put into a group with four other contestants to form One Direction. The group has released five commercially successful albums, performed four world tours, and won several awards. Payne has worked with other producers and writers such as Steve Mac, Johnny McDaid, and Ed Sheeran. He released his debut single "Strip That Down" in May 2017 and his debut album LP1 was released in December 2019. He has since released several singles, including "Stack It Up" and "Bedroom Floor". Payne is also an ambassador for several charities, including Comic Relief and Global Citizen.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Adil Rami.
output: Adil Rami is a French professional footballer who plays for Italian club AC Milan and the French national team. He is primarily a central defender but can also play as a right back. Born in Bastia, Corsica, Rami began his football career playing for amateur club Étoile Fréjus Saint-Raphaël. He turned professional in 2004 when he signed with Lille. He won two consecutive Ligue 1 titles in 2011 and 2012 with the club, and was also called up to the French national team in 2010. In 2013 he transferred to Valencia in Spain and won the Copa del Rey in the same year. He joined AC Milan in 2015, where he has won two Coppa Italia titles. He has also represented France at Euro 2012, the 2014 World Cup and Euro 2016, winning the latter.

output: Ronaldo Nazario de Lima, commonly known as Ronaldo, is a Brazilian retired professional footballer who played as a striker. Popularly dubbed "the phenomenon", he is widely considered to be one of the greatest football players of all time. He began his career as a youth player for Cruzeiro in 1985, before moving to Europe to join PSV Eindhoven, where he won two Eredivisie titles. He then signed for Barcelona in 1996, where he won two La Liga titles and the Copa del Rey. In 1997, he signed for Inter Milan, where he won the UEFA Cup and the Ballon d'Or. He then moved to Real Madrid in 2002, where he won two La Liga titles and the Champions League. At the international level, he is the all-time leading goalscorer for the Brazil national team, with 62 goals in 98 matches. He was a part of the Brazilian team that won the 1994 and 2002 FIFA World Cups, and he was named FIFA World Player of the Year twice. After retiring in 2011, he became a businessman and investor and was appointed as a Minister of Sport in Brazil in 2018.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Lina Medina.
output: Lina Medina (born September 23, 1933) is a Peruvian woman who became the youngest confirmed mother in history, giving birth at the age of five years, seven months, and 21 days. She is the oldest living person confirmed to have given birth. Medina was born in Ticrapo, Castrovirreyna Province, in the Department of Huancavelica, Peru, to parents Tiburelo Medina, a silversmith, and Victoria Losea. At five years old, she was brought to a hospital by her parents because of increasing abdominal size. Her parents, citing her development of a typically female body shape, thought she had a tumor. Upon examination, however, doctors determined that she was seven months pregnant. Following the examination, Medina gave birth by cesarean section to a baby boy on May 14, 1939, at the age of five years, seven months, and 21 days. The father was not identified. The baby weighed 2.7 kg (5.95 lbs) at birth and was named Gerardo after the doctor who delivered him. The gender of the baby was not revealed to Medina.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Tiffany Haddish.
output: Tiffany Haddish (born December 3, 1979) is an American comedian, actress, writer, and producer. She began her career as a stand-up comedian in the early 2000s, before appearing on television shows such as Def Comedy Jam (2002–2006) and Chelsea Lately (2009–2010). Haddish has since starred in films such as Girls Trip (2017), The Oath (2018), and Nobody's Fool (2018). She is also the voice of Tuca in the Netflix animated series Tuca & Bertie (2019). Her memoir, The Last Black Unicorn, was published in December 2017. Haddish won an Emmy for her guest appearance on Saturday Night Live in 2017, and she hosted the 2018 MTV Movie & TV Awards.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Mauro Icardi.
output: Mauro Emanuel Icardi (born 19 February 1993) is an Argentine professional footballer who plays as a striker for Italian Serie A club Inter Milan and the Argentine national team. He began his career at the age of nine with local club Rosario Central, and by the age of 15 had moved to Barcelona. After two seasons in Barcelona's youth system, Icardi signed for Sampdoria in 2011, and made his Serie A debut in December of that year. In 2013, he signed for Inter Milan and has since become one of the most prolific strikers in Italy, scoring 124 goals in 219 appearances for the club. He has also won four trophies with Inter, including the Coppa Italia in 2018 and the UEFA Europa League in 2020. Icardi has also earned 32 caps for Argentina, scoring eight goals.

output: Carlos Santana is a Mexican and American musician who is highly regarded as one of the greatest guitarists of all time. The band's first album, Santana, was released in 1969 and went on to garner widespread critical acclaim and commercial success. Throughout his long and distinguished career, Santana has released over 30 studio albums, won 10 Grammy Awards, and collaborated with some of the world's most renowned musicians, including John McLaughlin, Wayne Shorter, and Herbie Hancock. Santana is also known for blending musical styles, particularly Latin American, blues, and rock, into his own unique sound. He is also a respected philanthropist, having established the Milagro Foundation in 1998 to help underprivileged and at-risk children around the world.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Teresa Palmer.
output: Teresa Palmer is an Australian actress, writer, model, and activist. She was born on February 26, 1986 in Adelaide, South Australia. She began her career in 2004 with the Australian film, 2:37, and since then has starred in a number of films including The Grudge 2, December Boys, Bedtime Stories, I Am Number Four, Wish You Were Here, Warm Bodies, Lights Out, Hacksaw Ridge, and Berlin Syndrome. She has also appeared in television shows such as Law & Order: Special Victims Unit and Top of the Lake. As an activist, Teresa is an ambassador for the Australian Childhood Foundation and the Starlight Children's Foundation. She is also an advocate for animal rights and works to raise awareness around issues related to climate change.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Tim Fischer.
output: Tim Fischer (born 3 May 1946) is an Australian politician and diplomat. He is a former Deputy Prime Minister of Australia and leader of the National Party from 1990 to 1999. He was a Member of the House of Representatives for the electoral division of Farrer from 1984 to 2001. He was appointed Australia's Ambassador to the Holy See in 2008 and held this post until 2012. He was Deputy Prime Minister in the Howard Government from 1996 to 1999, and served as the Minister for Trade from 1996 to 1998. He was also the Minister for Transport and Regional Development from 1998 to 1999. Fischer was born in Lockhart, New South Wales, and later studied at the University of New England, Armidale, where he completed a Bachelor of Arts in Public Policy and Administration. He has since been awarded honorary doctorates from the University of New England and the University of Western Sydney. He is a passionate advocate of rail transport, and is the author of Aussie Logistics: The Train Journey of a Nation.

input: Question: Tell me a bio of Taika Waititi.
output: Taika Waititi (born August 16, 1975) is a New Zealand filmmaker, actor, writer and comedian. He was nominated for an Academy Award for his 2004 short film Two Cars, One Night. He is best known for directing the films Boy (2010), What We Do in the Shadows (2014), Hunt for the Wilderpeople (2016), Thor: Ragnarok (2017), and Jojo Rabbit (2019). He has also starred in the films Eagle vs Shark (2007), Boy (2010), and Hunt for the Wilderpeople (2016). Waititi's work is often characterized by its sense of humor, quirkiness, and deadpan delivery. He is of Te-Whanau-a-Apanui and Jewish descent.
